Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Claire M
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in this hotel. It is a peaceful hotel (rooms very quiet), with good showers and beds. Breakfast a bit expensive for us but there is a cafe in the next street, where you can get a good breakfast for a reasonable price. Otherwise the hotel is good value. You do have to pay for added extras but that is up to you and you can have a good stay without those extras. Metro is close by (about 4/5 minutes walk), to get anywhere by metro you will probably take 2 trains - but they run pretty regularly so it is not a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Great NH Hotel in upmarket location”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Fly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over a weekend while in Madrid. I found a good rate online of 40 EUR which is a fraction of what the business folks pay during the week. It's some distance from town but taxis are cheap (compared to UK) and the metro is handy too - 12min to Sol by metro. I didn't take breakfast as it was too expensive, but the room with wet room shower (loose fitting shower head was soon fixed though) and a comfortable bed hit the spot for me once again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles_please
Reviews.Content: Central, in a quite and cosy area, location is perfect if you wan to avoid the touristic center. Perfect for airport transfers too. Nice design and amazing superior rooms with a private rooftop terrassa. Loved it. Not an amazing service, but efficient one. Great for a week end for an average budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JaneRamsay5761
Reviews.Content: Checked in for three nights. Got the hotel as a secret 4 star hotel through Last Minute and wasn't disappointed. Room was stylish, modern and clean and about a 25 minute walk from town centre. Close to metro with great local cafes for breakfast and a handy supermarket nearby. The staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly Laura who gave us lots of good advice on where to eat and what to to see. Unfortunately, there was no hotel bar. However, with so many places nearby, this was not a big concern. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and use it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JeroenvdL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - central, very close to decent shopping, and not difficult to get to and from the airport. The rooms are modern, stylish and comfortable with everything you need. The hotel staff were pleasant and very helpful - all in all, a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “In the breed of refurbished short stay hotels”
Reviews.Author: 27thstring
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as a 'secret hotel part of a last minute package. This hotel is like a few short-stay travel lodges I've stayed at recently. Nicely refurbished with pleasant, modern decor, decent facilities such as TV, hair dryer, room safe etc, good location (about 20 minute walk from the main art galleries) and polished service. However, on the downside, it also has that annoying "add-on" options as offered by cheap airlines and lodges. Want a better view - 20 euros more. Want wifi? 30 minutes for 10 euros. Want breakfast...you get the picture. Some of these matter less than others, but for a city hotel, the lack of free wifi is somewhat annoying. Also, it adds a cheaper air to what otherwise looks like a pretty nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small - Expensive WIFI”
Reviews.Author: ddbxl
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small, not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. The room itself was quite ok, nothing to complaint about, except the size. Internet is free only in the lobby. There is an expensive internet service available in the rooms. If you consider that internet is available for free even in the cheapest b&b, this business model of charging for the internet is really nonsense. Breakfast was quite good. Buffet with lost of options.

Reviews.Title: “I loved that hotel! Great staff, very comfortable modern room & price!”
Reviews.Author: marqoos_pl
Reviews.Content: I have booked one night in NH Principe de Vergara as a stopover in Madrid. I have read previous reviews and decided to try. I have to admit, that this was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences I've ever had. I would love to have other hotels to be as good as this property! From the airport you could get there using metro with one change only - just follow clear instructions on the hotel's website. Check-in was quick, efficient and totally hassle-free. All reception staff was professional and natural at the same time. I loved that approach. All questions answered with any unnecessary questions or procedures. Lobby is very modern, bright and decorated with light-colours. I've got room #704. I didn't expect much, but I was delighted with the room. Trendy, modern, up-to-date decor. Spotless clean and fresh and I think selection of colours and materials chosen are great. Air-condition was quiet and easy to use. Flat screen TV, free safety deposit box, phone, fridge, large wardrobe are only few amenities there. What is worth pointing, that prices of the mini-bar are very reasonable and fair - you can easily use that and your pocket will not be emptied as in other hotels for the same stuff. There is a Wi-Fi Internet access and price is 10,80 EUR for 24h - acceptable. Connection is fast and non-problematic log-in. Bathroom was another masterpiece of hotel design. Glass-walled shower, large mirror, hair-dryer, selection of good quality toiletries and fluffy towels is provided. Actually, I'd love to buy some of these cosmetics in the future. Unfortunately I didn’t have chance to try their breakfast, but room looked really inviting early in the morning. Overall my experience of the NH Principe de Vergara Hotel was very good. Definitely I can recommend it to my friends, clients (I'm a travel consultant) and fellow travellers. This is great choice and I'm sure I will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “One Night of Ultimate Comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Joshua R
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Madrid! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. My boyfriend and I stayed one night and found it to be easy to get to by metro and bus. The #52 bus stop is right out front and gets you to the fun part of the city in about 10-15 minutes. The only downfall was the WI-FI. You had to go to the lobby and you only could use it for 30 minute intervals. With that said, I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Great Staff, Wi Fi needs change”
Reviews.Author: Larry G
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean,modern and friendly staff. There's a grocery store across the street for purchasing food, snacks, wine, beer etc. My only complaint is with their Wi Fi set up. My wife and I stayed in several hotels in Spain on this trip and in all of them Wi Fi hook up was easy. A password and user i.d was provided at the check in counter, usage was unlimited free and available in your room. Very convenient. However, at this hotel the password and user i.d was only good for 30 minutes and internet access was only available in the lobby. When your session timed out you'd have to enter a new password and another user i.d. I tried for 45 minutes to get on without success. Although the clerk seemed knowledeable, he couldn't explain why I couldn't get on. I was offered the use of their business desktop (there was only one and it was occupied) but I couldn't wait. I tried again the next morning and still had no luck. Another traveller in our party also couldn't get on? For a modern hotel I can't understand why they don't have unlimited and easy access to this important service and in the privacy of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean; great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: grmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in May. Rooms facing away from the street, towards the tall building with the Iberia sign on top, are quiet. Ours was on the 4th floor. Bus 52 stops in front of the hotel in one direction and across the steet in the other, and for 1 euro and a half will deliver you to the tourist area in about 10 minutes, and is also near the bus stop for the airport bus (we used a taxi, which costs between 25 and 30 euros, depending on traffic..the bus would have been much less expensive, but slower of course. If you are going to the airport from the hotel, allow yourself a lot of time. The Madrid airport is large, security is on a par with major US airports, and it can take a lot of time to get to your gate). Breakfasts at all NH hotels are superb if you like a hearty one, and worth the cost in terms of quality, quantity, and convenience. The hotel rooms are adequate in size and well appointed, and clean. Given the quality and service, and location away from the hubbub of the city center, this hotel is a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stop in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked exactly as it does online. The staff were fantastic - great directions always friendly (greeting you as you came and went) the housekeeping staff even hung my drying laundry on the towel rack (I went out and left my dripping pants hanging on the small shelf in the shower and came back to them on the towel rack hung much nicer than how I left them). The hotel is a bit out of the city but easy to get around by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Small beds and no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Jabulani2012
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that they do not offer wifi as they do in other hotels, especially in Spain. The beds are 160 or less ( i mean double beds!) Very clean and well located near the Serrano area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain of”
Reviews.Author: JustJoeKing
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NH Principe de Vergara for two nights (business trip). The hotel is very close to a metro station (Avenida de America), 2-3 minutes walk from the exit (just follow the Principe de Vergara exit signs; the hotel is on the same side as a petrol station, just go down the street). The check-in & check-out process went quickly, staff was very friendly, nice and professional. I found my room clean and spacious. Although it was next to the elevator, I couldn't hear anything from the outside (other guest waiting for the lift etc.) and the room seemed well sound-isolated. In the bathroom you can turn on speakers and listen to a programme that you have running on TV in the room (it was very relaxing taking a shower and listening to music :) ). There are enough different TV programmes available (many different languages). There was just enough of choice of food for breakfast in my opinion. I am not very picky and can always find something to eat, but I only sort of missed more vegetables (like tomato, cucumbers, olives ...). On request they can also prepare for you eggs, bacon ... Someone could, however, miss broader choice of different food, but in my opinion everyone can find something for him/her and not to leave breakfast hungry. The food was fresh and delicious. If I remember correctly, you can use 15 minutes of free wi-fi internet (you ask in the reception for a password). In the lobby there's a computer and again, if I am not wrong, a minute of use costs 0,37 eur. I didn't need to use it so I can't judge about the price of this service. On my way back to the airport (weekday in the morning), I needed cca. 35 minutes from the hotel to the exit of metro station at Terminal 2 at the aeroporto (so - very quick!). I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevieDScotland
Reviews.Content: First time to Madrid and stayed at the Principe de Vergara Hotel. The hotel is located in a good area of the city and the rooms were modern, well equipped and following advice from earlier comments, quiet, after requesting room to the rear. Staff are all very helpful and the breakfast is very good. Choice is extensive and the opening times generous. Free wi-fi is also available located within reception lobby. Getting around, we pretty much walked most of the time. It takes prob 20 mins or so to main park, Retiro, and is a must to have a look around. We hired out bikes which made it a bit easier because the park is huge. We also got the city bus tour - well worth it and saved us walking all the time. There are 2 routes available, the cost of which covers both. One day charge is 20 euros, 24 euros for 2 days use. You can buy a ticket on the bus or at the various kiosks. One of the routes does come up closer to the hotel which is handy. Public bus route also available and relatively cheap right outside hotel. As for eating out, I would thoroughly recommend Cazorla. Turn left outside front of the hotel, walk approx 2 blocks until you see a '7' sign for a convenience store and take a right at that junction. One block along you will see the restaurant at corner where you can either stand at the bar or have a sit down meal. Not too expensive and the food is good quality tapas and main dishes. Well worth it and only 5-10 min walk away. A great trip had by all and the hotel was ideal - would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_j0ck
Reviews.Content: Hotel provided good clean room that was exactly what we needed for our weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and trendy...”
Reviews.Author: dubmar
Reviews.Content: I've spent two months in this NH for business last November and December. The hotel has been recently renovated and is nicely decorated. The staff has always been nice and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet is of very good quality. The hotel is also very convenient for business and is well located. There is a garage, but the places are limited. The hotel also has a small fitness room, but you can not access it before 8h in the morning which is a little bit inconvenient. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay, I would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money but thin walls in some rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Tam1904
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews regarding the rooms facing Principe de Vergara and requested a room facing the interior part of the hotel so I could avoid the noise from the street. I arrived early in the morning (9 am) on Christmas day after a long overnight flight and the first remark I have to make is that if you have a heavy suitcase and cannot lift it yourself,you may have a problem because there are no bellhops and no ramp to wheel suitcases up,so you have to tackle about 20 stairs to go into the hotel. I was greeted by a very nice red-headed young man who was the receptionist (just pointing this out because he was the nicest and most helpful receptionist of all the ones I encountered during my stay) and who made no fuss about me checking in that early (a welcome change from the inflexible US hotels where one has to languish in a jet-lagged daze in the lobby for hours until the "official" check-in time which can be as late as 3 pm in some cases) and also kindly gave me a king-sized bed (room 307),which I was happy about.It was on a smoking floor (due to the early hour, there were no other quiet,king-size bedrooms available and the receptionist told me that if by chance it smelled of smoke too much, he'd find me another option) but thankfully, the room did not smell of smoke (only the corridor on that floor).It was a small room but nicely decorated (modern style),good thick windows,your own heating/cooling control, an area to sit at a table, a minibar, comfortable bed (though some may find it a little hard,but for me it was fine) and very quiet. The flat screen TV on the wall had a multitude of channels and with the remote you could see the movies on the Spanish channels in their original versions instead of dubbed,which was a nice touch.Unfortunately,the satellite did not seem to be working well for some of the channels but I was pretty tired and did not watch much TV anyway. The bathroom had a shower (I would have preferred a tub) .The water pressure was good and it was a rain shower with the option of switching the water-flow to a handheld shower,which I appreciated very much since I don't like getting my hair wet.Unfortunately, the door to the shower is not very effective and the whole bathroom was pretty much flooded by the time I got out of the shower every time I used it,so it's something to be careful with so one does not slip on the way out. After a couple of nights, I stayed at a friends place and then I came back for another couple of nights. On my second stay ,I was given the same type of room but on the 6th floor (607), a non-smoking floor. This was around the New year and the hotel had booked a very noisy couple in the room next to mine who was part of a larger group that had rooms also on that floor. I could hear every single word that was spoken by this couple (and they spoke very loudly,laughing,playing music,whistling...all audible as if they were in my room).The whole group also shouted in the corridors and banged doors continually which was very disagreeable.I called reception and they said they would talk to them but I am not sure they did because the noise continued.Regardless,I managed to sleep very well (I sleep with earplugs) but when you are watching TV (the channels worked very well in this room) or just trying to work in your room it does become very bothersome to hear every single thing that goes on in the room next door.The room had a connecting door so perhaps other rooms that don't have connecting doors are quieter. On one occasion I did not feel like going out to eat and visited the hotel's "restaurant",which really has a very limited offering.I ordered a cream of asparagus which was very acid,to the point I wondered if it had turned bad or something ( it hadn't because I was ok after eating it and did not get sick,so it was just that the soup was awful tasting) and also it was very expensive:8 Euros and 50 cents so I would really recommend eating at one of the many restaurants/bars in the area and not in the hotel.A tip about the internet: they have free wi-fi in the lobby but they charge you 10 Euros if you want to use it in your room (for 24 hours).But if you are in your room and connect to the internet from there, you can get the same 24 hours for "only" 8 Euros and 85 cents by paying with your credit card on the screen that pops up. So don't buy from the hotel,buy it in your room if you have to.I cannot comment on the breakfast because I was so jet-lagged I never managed to get up in time to have it,but I was impressed that they offered it until 11 am which is great if you like to sleep in.The hotel's location is good, close to the exit to the airport so you don't have to deal with the traffic that more centrally located hotels have and close to the metro which takes you everywhere very quickly and inexpensively.There are plenty of restaurants around and the neighborhood is very safe. All in all, and specially for the great rate I got of 64 Euros including breakfast (the first two nights,the second nights it was without breakfast but still a good rate) and a late check-out time included (until 5 pm!), I would definitely stay there again.The only thing I would do different is ask for a room without connecting doors to the room next door because of the noise issue and I would ask for a room with a tub.But I really liked this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FreeMind
Reviews.Content: Chose the Principe de Vergara due to its location between Barajas Airport and downtown. A convenient and cheap bus connection to Avenida de America bus station (busline 200, off-peak trip around 15 min). A walking distance from the hotel even to the city center, about 30 min, but also Metro stations (Avenida de America, Diego de Leon) nearby. Rooms recently renovated, comfortable and modern design. Nice bathroom, a bit dark, though. Breakfast expensive but there are coffee shops in the neighborhood. A good choice for a short stay. No complaints about the service. Free internet in the lobby but so slow connection...

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a poor service”
Reviews.Author: pierre.lima
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, the refurbishment in 2010 was successful but we found the hotel quite expensive. Beside that our room was too noisy, perhaps because we stay on a first floor room facing the busy Avenida Principe de Vergara. We also found the service poor and not attentive enough for a four star hotel. After booking four rooms, two of them with baby cot, we were told on arrival that there was no cots available (!) and, when asking for an extra pillow, I had to wait almost one hour because of the reception's change of turn. The bar service was also poor and the dishes of a snack that we had taken during the afternoon, in the lobby, still were on the same table when we returned from dinner four hours later. We won't stay at NH Principe de Vergara hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: becksta75
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary hotel which will appeal to those who like modern and minimal design. We had room 807 which did not offer us a view from the window but I was very impressed with the standard of the room itself. The room has a large wardrobe with an easy to use personal safe. There is a good size wall mounted flatscreen TV which had a good quality picture and the bathroom is probably one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel room! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we felt it was expensive but it did look plentiful. There are plenty of cafes within walking distance that could provide you with an alternative. The hotel bar was a bit of a disappointment and had no real atmosphere. It is shared with the breakfast room which is sectioned off outside the hours of operation. We only had one drink in here and prefered to sample the local alternatives. The hotel is located approx 15-20 minutes from the centre of Madrid (Sol area) by metro but you can use the Avenida de America station which is a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. This station is an interchange so you can get onto several different lines from here. The metro is so easy to use and we felt very safe using it too. There are plenty of shops and eateries in the local area but you could walk into the swanky Salamanca discrict (Calle de Serrano) which took us about 20 minutes. Overall I would happily stay here again. My only critisism is that although the hotel is very professional it is slightly impersonable.

Reviews.Title: “A breakfast so good it would grace a hotel that costs five times the asking price!”
Reviews.Author: gjamesscl
Reviews.Content: GENERAL INFORMATION Date of stay: October 30 2011 Travelled with: - Room number: 415 First impression: "Great modern design. Clean and simple" View from window: The side wall of the building next door and an inside patio. SERVICE Very friendly staff in the reception and at breakfast. FACILITIES & PRACTICAL STUFF Gym: Small and basic Pool: None Bar: Cocktail bar on Ground Floor And their Martini?: Very short stay. No time to find out! Restaurant: On Ground Floor. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Can I shine my shoes before I leave?: Only by using the little kit in your room. Was the Concierge on-the-ball?: Not really, but the receptionist made up for that. THE IN-ROOM EXPERIENCE The room: Small and well-equipped. Internet: Wireless wi-fi costs about 10 Euros for 24 hours. Beware: Only allows one laptop connection at a time. Weak signal in this room. In-room dining: Good menu of typical hotel fodder. Mini-bar: Limited but tempting and fairly priced. TV: 30-inch Philips LCD Iron & board: Not in the room The bed: Comfortable, if a little on the firm side. OUTSIDE Nearby runs: Very urban. At least a 15-minute run from the nearest decent park. Nearby attractions: Close to the posh Salamanca district. Nearby bars and dining: Quite a few just a couple of blocks away. For the authentic Spanish experience, try Restaurant Aylagas on Castello 100. Best thing about the hotel: The breakfast; amazing array of fresh fruit, hams, cheeses, pastries, omelettes on-command, great coffee, myriad types of milk (soya, vanilla soya!), and perhaps the most beautiful presentation I have ever seen. They also held my luggage for a week without charge. Worst thing about the hotel: Why oh why must they charge for internet? Additional comments: I'd highly recommend this property to anyone who opts for modern and functional as opposed to ostentatious.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy spot in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joanixNy
Reviews.Content: Right at the center and close to the subway, trendy hotel with a trendy restaurant and a good service. you will often find very good promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster94
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the NH Principe de Vergara. We chose this hotel because it was located close to our friends' house. It is a short 15 min/10euro cab ride from the airport. The rooms are small but modern and tastefully decorated. I love the fact that there are hardwood floors in the rooms - I wish more hotels would do this! The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We did not try the restaurant, but there is one on site. We will not hesitate to stay here in the future when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: turist_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is located close to Avenida de America (circular) metro and bus station. Bus was very convenient way to travel to an airport (only 20min trip) and it costs only 2 euro. Reception service was very polite. Room and bathroom was clean. Room has safe and small fridge (drinks for surcharge). It is approximately 20 min walk to Serrano shopping area. Cons: Walls are thin, you can hear everything. Wi-fi service for fee. Overpriced breakfast (14 euros per person). It is not close to Prado museum and other major attractions; however, it is easy to reach it by train. At night it wasn’t convenient, since we had spend 30-40 min on travel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filomena R
Reviews.Content: I like modern hotels and this is very well decorated. Rooms are very comfortable, cheerful and functional. Not very large, but large enough. Nights are very silent, what is good if your are looking to rest from a walking around or working day. Breakfast is fabulous, including for your diet, if you want, of course! There are lots of calories available, including churros and tortilla, but also really tasty and healthy food (fruits, vegetables and fruit real juices, seeds, cereals, a variety of milks, which includes nuts milk that I had never seen or taste before, salads, cheeses, including low fat,etc, etc...). The egg and bacon lovers can also find it, freshly made by request, if they have the stomach to start the day that way!... :-)! The staff is helpful, but could be more, especially at the meals room, where they are quick to ask your room number, but seem to forget to find you a table. But there are so many positive aspects that you will not mind to find it yourselves. The business center is little but works its purpose. You are very near the metro and airport connection (in Avenida de América) and to the fancy stores of calle serrano, and of the most business places in Paseo de la Castelhana. Fine choice in Salamanca Neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juan57
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business from Friday to Monday. Room was excellent,not huge but comfortable. What surprised me greatfully was the restaurant, the food was great, reasonably priced(compared to local restaurants).The hotel is very well located and in a nice area. The service was great and anything that did not work was fixed inmediately.Will definately go back if in Madrid.Two comments 1) There should be a ramp to access the hotel from the street, I asked and becuase of the angle of the stairs the City Council doesn´t allow it. There is a elevator for impaired people though.2) Shower though very confortable leaks into the floor. ( a towel solves the issue)( note to the management :the NH Santa Fe in Ciudad de Mexico has solved that issue brilliantly)

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but the location isn't great.”
Reviews.Author: ashandbecky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Salamanca district of Madrid. It is very easy to get to from the airport via the metro system (Costs 2.50 euro per person). The area is pleasant and quiet but quite far out from the centre of Madrid. It is perfect for those who want a peaceful nights sleep away from the hustle and bustle of the city! It took us about half an hour to walk to the city centre or you can take the 5 minute walk to the Diego de Leon Metro station which then takes about 10 minutes. The hotel itself was very nice and modern although our room was on the rather small side. The view from our room wasn't particularly inspirational, it was of the other side of the hotel. The mini bar in the room was very reasonably priced (for a hotel mini bar!). Wifi internet was available at a cost of about 16 euros for 24 hours. We did not eat in the restaurant so I cannot comment on the service and quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “NH standards, but they have no proper baby bed causing 3 nights of restless”
Reviews.Author: mariusb
Reviews.Content: Modern decorated rooms and enough large, good location in posh Salamanca, good breakfast, 15' of free internet, reliable transport connections - in one word, all standard things you normally expect when paying 100EURO/night (outregeuosly expensive during the weekend in a city like Madrid!!). Unfortunately for us (and this is a SHAME for a 4* hotel chain!!) they have no proper baby crib for our 2 years daughter - after many conversations with the clerks, only in the second day they somehow "adjusted" the initial baby bed by putting some pillows and towels around the wood frame - because not being a safe way, this cause us a 3 nights of restless. As a "bonus", during that w/e there was the Pope's visit and a very noisy group of teenagers were accomodated up/down/left/right of our room, so we should call many times to reception to calm down the juvenile exhuberance - this turned an expected luxury experience in a very hostel like one, while not coming also with the bargain price of the latter. Why NH accepted it?...oh, yes!, social PR of the network....dissapointing approach for the standard clients (payers)...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but I had a feeling”
Reviews.Author: isaHolanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel. The rooms are small but have everything that you need. A/C works perfect! The room is clean, housekeepers do their work fine, but in the bathroom and in the floor of the room there were stains everywhere. So I had the feeling that it wasn't clean. I saw the housekeeper with all her cleaning equipment, so I guess she cleans well, but like I just said it doesn't seem clean... I was wearing sleepers all times in the room, normally in hotels I feel free to be barefooted in my room, but it wasn't the situation here. The shower doesn't work properly, when you stepped out it drops a lot of water, so you need an extra towel in the floor. Location is great, very close to metro Avenida de America and Diego de Leon. Close to nice restaurants and friendly staff. Breakfast was fine, but if you visit one of the "cervecerias" in the neighborhood, you get more for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated hotel in posh Salamanca”
Reviews.Author: GL0BETR0TTER73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on and off for a couple of weeks time. The hotel is all newly renovated and feels modern on the inside even though the outside looks quite dull. Do add the extra euros for a superior room as they have in-room coffee machines and large balconies or terraces on the 7'th and 8'th floor. The rooms on the 8'th floor are facing the courtyard and the terraces are larger and have sunbeds. Breakfast was really good with a lot to choose from and they offer hot food a la carte, included in the breakfast price. Staff was generally nice, restaurant and room service was prompt. However the cleaning was so-so, often leaving used coffee cups or glasses behind in the room. Wifi worked well but was pricey. €10 for using the internet in the room for a day, however you can ask for a complimentary 30 min wifi access in the lobby area. The location was in great in my opinion. Just around the corner from Avenida de América interchange station, giving access to local and regional buses, metro and airport coaches. Bus line 200 leaves to/from Barajas at least every 15 min and costs only €1, taking around 30 minutes. Just a few blocks away in the other direction you'll find the heart of the restaurant and shopping area in Madrid including Serrano and Goya avenues.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient, quiet location, but....”
Reviews.Author: cfonde
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, and adequate but nothing special. Mattresses were a bit hard, but that seems to be the standard in Spain. TV was large flatscreen, which was a nice addition. Shower was odd, in that you had to step up into it, and water could easily leak under the glass door, onto the floor below. Otherwise, for my 3-night stay, the room was quiet, as I was at the back, overlooking apartments. Breakfast buffet was good. Front Desk personnel were helpful, even allowed me to store excess items that were not needed for a 1 week trip to Canary Islands. They also allow 15 minutes free internet access in their Business Center per day. Overall, the location is extremely convenient, in an upscale neighborhood of Madrid (Salamanca), which has numerous shops, restaurants, cafe's, etc. Transportation to/from the airport is easy, as "Avenida de America" station is 2 blocks away. There you can catch the Metro or direct bus (#200) to the airport. Hotel is half-way between the airport and city center. Metro makes it easy to get anywhere in Madrid. Got a good price on Expedia, and would stay again, but only if the price was right again. I also stayed at the Hotel Madrono about 2 blocks away, and I liked it better.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polly2us
Reviews.Content: Spent our first 2 nights in Madrid in the hotel. No complaints as the hotel is quiet. Good breakfast. Close to a metro stop. Beds comfortable which is always a plus. Desk staff very helpful with directions on the map with a restaurant we were trying to find.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior71
Reviews.Content: The good - good location near shopping areas and public transportation. The room was clean and quiet but small. I stayed for about the same price (160e) in the Montparnasse area of Paris in a much bigger room. The bad The TV didn't work and it turned out they had disconnected the internal connection (in the TV). They fixed it promptly on calling but I don't understand why it was disconnected in the first place. Internet service was provided through a dog slow (200kpbps) wireless connection even though the room card said it should be wired. For 25e/day, it was not worth it. I have paid that much in Rome and Paris for much speedier connections. The breakfast was very good, though not as large as American buffets, but not included in the room price. The only frequent flyer credits you get were not for my preferred airlines and I don't think they're part of any American hotel network (Marriott, Hilton, Starwood, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: henrieta
Reviews.Content: The positive views: We could hardly hear any outside traffic, although the hotel is at a busy street. The reception, lobby and restaurant are very nice. The toiletries in the bathroom are really good. The staff is helpful. The negative views: We stayed on the first floor. The double room which we got was actually two single beds put together. They were on the wheels, which meant that every time I moved the bed moved too. The mattress was not comfortable. The window was extremely small. I couldn't see if it was sunny or cloudy outside and it was extremely dark in the room. The bathroom had some real issues and I had a feeling it was not very clean. I think that especially bathrooms need to be renovated. This room didn't feel like a 4 stars hotel. I would give it 3 stars. We checked out after 2 nights because we found a very nice and new 5 stars hotel not far away from there for almost the same price because they gave us a weekend rate, which this NH hotel didn’t offer at all. If it was a weekend rate which they wanted to charge us, it was really too high for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: RossyFan
Reviews.Content: The previous review sums up the hotel nicely. It's a good hotel in a fairly quiet part of Madrid. I thought I would, however, just add some practical information for getting to and from the city which is about two miles or so away as the transport links are really good. The number 52 bus runs every few minutes during the day and fairly frequently at night and weekends.It takes about ten minutes to reach the terminus at Puerta del Sol. The stop is a five minutes walk to the right as you leave the hotel on Principe de Vergara. The last bus back from Sol is around 11.30 pm but there are night buses (N2 and N4) which leave from Plaza de la Cibeles (by the elegant main Post Office) . Amazingly these even ran, every 30 minutes, in the early hours of New Years morning, much to our relief as we had resigned ourselves to walk back after the New Year celebrations in Sol. The metro stop,Avenda de America, is just beyond the bus stop about 150 yeards from the hotel. A ten trip ticket, which can be used on either bus or metro is exceptional value at euro 6-15. Hope this review helps, we have stayed in the centre of Madrid before. Whilst it's handy to be able to walk to most places we enjoyed the relative quiet of being just outstide the city. Salamanca is a nice part of Madrid and there are good restaurants and bars to wind down in close by after a days sightseeing. Alernatively, because public transport is so good, it's easy to get to and from the city centre for an evening meal out. I would stay here again.
